job_title: Box Office Associate in New York, NY
pros: great place to work and great colleagues
cons: no cons have I found

job_title: Production Staff in New York, NY
pros: Decent benefits, no overhead, ability to work longterm
cons: Constant revolving door or employees, no management, very little continuity

job_title: Director Special Events in New York, NY
pros: Great organization in a period of growth. Friendly staff and faculty. Good facilities.
cons: Some leadership personalities are troubling. A lot of egos and the need to walk on eggshells. Seems to be no recourse for manager feedback. Very antiquated filing systems.

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Great community at the school. Loved all of my coworkers, and the student community we serve is superb.
cons: Base pay is too low. Administrators are expected to work a lot of hours for very little pay. Some positions only offer minimum wage.

job_title: Library Technical Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Very easy going, laid back, friendly work environment.
cons: No space for growth or career development.

job_title: Assistant Director in New York, NY
pros: MSM has a small community feel.
cons: Not many positions for advancing career.

job_title: Database Manager in New York, NY
pros: There are good benefits for employees
cons: The organization as a whole is disorganized

job_title: Associate in New York, NY
pros: Friendly, Room to Grow, Good Colleagues
cons: Temper-mental budget, no consistency, students cannot register for classes online

job_title: Teacher in New York, NY
pros: Nicely paid and they select administration stuffs from alumni
cons: Not nicely paid, and the working hours are long

review_title: Good Community of People and Students
job_title: Administrative Assistant (Work-study) in New York, NY
pros: Great place to work. Had two awesome bosses in the student engagement office. I worked their doing work study while completing my degree.
cons: No real cons. Just had to do the simple work and focus.

review_title: Good experience as a doctoral teaching fellow
job_title: Doctoral Teaching Fellow; Tutoring Program Coordinator in New York, NY
pros: I had the opportunity to teach aural skills and music theory classes for three years as a Doctor of Musical Arts teaching fellow in the theory department.  Supervisor is very organized, students are generally talented and enthusiastic.  I taught freshmen, sophomores, and grad students at various levels.  Great teaching experience!
cons: MSM's bureaucracy and operations can be rather wonky and outdated; i.e., lots of filling out lengthy forms for things that really should be done online.  Pay is not great at this school, especially in light of the cost of living in NYC.  Difficult to reserve or find practice rooms.

review_title: Working as Instrumental Accompanist is one of my most unforgettable experience at MSM !
job_title: Instrumental Accompanist in New York, NY
pros: Good opportunities for networking, performing, and learning new instrumental repertoire s. You will get to know many prestigious instrumental instructors and talented students, to perform in their recitals, juries, master classes, and competitions, and to develop professional skills you need to collaborate with other musicians in the real world.
cons: There are so many talented pianists at MSM (or I can say, in the entire NYC), so instrumentalists may not necessarily choose MSM instrumental accompanists to play with them.

job_title: Jazz Band Director In the Summer in New York, NY
pros: The staff is cool, the students are super talented, the atmosphere is thriving and the facilities are nice. The work load is the right amount and its in a cool place in Manhattan, close to Harlem and The Heights.
cons: Some times some of the faculty can be a little insufferable. The air conditioning sometimes didn't work during the summer.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: 2 weeks off for holiday time that is not counted towards vacation days. 8 Summer Fridays with the full day off. Student body is very talented and warm people. location is beautiful next to Columbia and Sakura park.
cons: Suffers from 'thats the way weve always done it' kind of mentality and enough heirarchy to not get things radically changed. Health care plan used to be fantastic, now has a $1,500 deductible

job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Great position to hold while studying there. Understanding the business side and what it takes to run a conservatory is asset you can have for life. Great Faculty.
cons: I did not have to deal with this directly and the issue may have changed by now, but many   employees have complained about health care.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Time off: vacation, sick day, summer fridays,2 weeks off for the holidays in December and additional holiday days.
cons: Management is very disrespectful, rude and careless, some have no clue of how to complete their duties. Most management promoted not by their time or work but mainly because of who they know. They overwork lower level employees without good pay. Management and selective employees who are friends with higher-ups receive additional raises than the yearly minimum raise. NO ANNUAL REVIEW. NO HR. NO ONE TO ADVOCATE FOR MSM EMPLOYEES.

review_title: Poor management, disorganized, long hours, low pay
job_title: Administrative Assistant in New York, NY
pros: Paid time off and the school's location is nice
cons: Negative office culture, poor management, high turnover, and lack of training

review_title: MSM is a great place to work
job_title: Anonymous Employee in New York, NY
pros: Excellent upper administration and you work with people who really care about the students and the student experience.
cons: It's hard to find a work-life balance; there is frequent work contact with colleagues and supervisors outside of normal working hours.

review_title: Really Nice People, Wish there were more hours
job_title: Stagehand in New York, NY
pros: Like the title said the production staff are really kind and patient. If there are things you don’t know or don’t feel comfortable doing they will assist you.
cons: Not enough shifts given per week.

job_title: Associate in New York, NY
pros: Easy to move up/get promoted. Lots of opportunity for learning and growth.
cons: Overworked and large separation between staff and upper administration.  Poor communication between faculty. Often feel you are working against students, faculty and other staff members.

job_title: Administrator in New York, NY
pros: I loved my time at Manhattan School of Music. Everyone who work there has a passion for their work.
cons: The salary is not very competitive due.

review_title: Opera Theater Scheduler / Assistant Stage Manager
job_title: Opera Theater Scheduler/Assistant Stage Manager in New York, NY
pros: Artistic Excellence is priority in the work
cons: Unrealistic Goals for work assignments
